Both of these movies are related to the Kennedy assassination in different ways. 'JFK' is a historical drama film that tells the story of President John F Kennedy's assassination on November 22, 1963, at the Texas School for the Blind and Deaf in Dallas, Texas. The film stars Kevin Spacey as President Kennedy, Patrick Stewart as Attorney General Robert F. Kennedy, and Benicio Del Toro as Lee Harvey Oswald.
On the other hand, 'The Stuff' is a science fiction horror film that tells the story of the mysterious goo that oozes from the earth in different parts of the world. The film stars Danny Aiello as the scientist who discovers the strange goo, Garrett Morris as the African man who lives on the coast where the strange goo is found, and Paul Sorvino as the Asian man who lives in an area where the strange goo is found.
On the other hand, 'Tarnation' is a documentary film that tells the story of growing up with his schizophrenic mother. The film stars Renee Leblanc as the daughter who grew up with her schizophrenic mother, Greg Ayres as the father who grew up with his schizophrenic mother, and Jonathan Caouette as the filmmaker who documented the experiences of his daughter growing up with her schizophrenia
